TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1143
TEI.2.document_title: Jacob Betts to Stephen F Austin, 06-27-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Jacob Betts to Austin, June 27, 1825. Apology for letter of May 13.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1143

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Jacob Betts to Austin, June 27, 1825. Apology for letter of May 13.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="06-27-1825">June the 27 1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col Steven F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir I Rote you a few Lines some day after I saw you—perhaps at time when not calculated to compose any thing it may be possible you are Right in your statement to me and me wrong if so I hope I shall discuver it I shall not Return as soon as I expected when I Rot to you though I shall not be gon Long if you think proper to Let me have the *location_mentioned*half Leag of Land*/location_mentioned* and no more you will pleas arange the metter for me and when I Return I shall endeavor to settle with you you stated to me perhaps you could be of servis to me in securing other Land I suspect you can if you are dispose to do me the favour and I am convinst of my error you will find [me] submisive as fair as is Reasonable if you Let me have the Land I shall depend on you to arang the matter for me*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jacob Betts*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
